Key Match Events: Ismaïla Sarr scored the all-important goal in the 71st minute after converting from the penalty spot.
Senegal registered their first victory in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifiers after downing Burundi 1-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Senegal, the 2021 AFCON champions, found themselves in an unexpectedly challenging position after a surprising 1-1 draw at home to Burkina Faso.
The Teranga Lions were desperate to bounce back against the Swallows, who went into the fixture top of Group L after an impressive 3-2 away win against Malawi in their opener.
Heading into the fixture, Aliou Cisse’s men had just lost once in full-time over their previous twenty-three games.
Senegal finished at the top of their group in their last appearance in this tournament, securing fourteen points from a combined eighteen.
